g13

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • g13.Edge

  • public abstract class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    Eventhough it is named 'Edge' this class models undirected weighted edges.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(Node m1, Node m2, double w)
      Creates a weighted edge between two nodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      Node getNeighbor(Node n)
      If n is a node that belongs to the edge (i.e the edge contains a node n' such that n.equals(n')), this function returns its neighbor.
      Node getNode()
      Returns the smallest node of the edge
      double getWeight()
      Returns the Edge's weight
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this edge.
      void setWeight(double w)
      Edge's weight setter.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the Edge.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Edge

        public Edge(Node m1,
            Node m2,
            double w)
        Creates a weighted edge between two nodes. Note that the two nodes supplied must not be the same and the weight must be a strictly positive number
        Parameters:
        m1 - One of the two nodes of the edge
        m2 - The other node of the edge
        w - The weight of the edge
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if m1 is null or m2 is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if m1.equals(m2) or w is not a strictly positive number

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The object to compare with the edge
        Returns:
        Returns true if and only if the edge e has equal nodes as this Edge (no matter the order)

      • getNeighbor

        public Node getNeighbor(Node n)
        If n is a node that belongs to the edge (i.e the edge contains a node n' such that n.equals(n')), this function returns its neighbor. Otherwise it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        n - The node whose neighbor is requested
        Returns:
        Given one of the two nodes of the Edge, it returns the other one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if n is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n is not one of the nodes of the edge

      • getNode

        public Node getNode()
        Returns the smallest node of the edge
        Returns:
        the smallest node of the edge

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Returns the Edge's weight
        Returns:
        the Edge's weight

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value for this edge. Note that this method is needed for using Edges as HashSet or HashMap keys properly
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a hash code value for this edge

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(double w)
        Edge's weight setter. The supplied weight value must be a strictly positive number.
        Parameters:
        w - The desired weight value for the edge.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the weight is not a strictly positive number

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the Edge. Note that the nodes of the edge are printed in increasing order, so for example if nodes were integers both Edge 3,2 and Edge 2,3 would be printed as 2,3
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of the Edge
